L'ultimo modello a batteria √É¬® entrato nel Guinness dei primati con un'impresa: muovere un aereo da 300 tonnellate. Ma non √É¬® solo show, questo attrezzo √É¬® un piccolo gioiello tech per il fai-da-te.

author: Poulami Saha
title: Stop using these passwords: You've been warned - Technology News | The Financial Express
text:
Haven‚Äôt we all used passwords such as ‚Äò1234‚Äô, ‚Äòpassword‚Äô or any similar easy passwords for securing our devices. But these easy to remember passwords could not be strong enough to secure your device. As reported by NoredPass, a password manager, these are weak passwords. In addition to this it has also come up with a list of weak passwords. Let‚Äôs have a detailed look at the weak password and most used weak passwords.
Also Read Warning! WhatsApp wedding invitation scam can steal all your money with a single click Top weak passwords revealed In its sixth edition of ‚ÄúTop 200 Most Common Passwords‚Äù, NordPass showcased the top 20 commonly used passwords in India. Given below is the detailed list:
123456 Password 12345678 123456789 Abcd1234 12345 qwerty123 1234567890 India123 1qaz@WSX Qwerty1 Qwerty 1234567 Password India123 Indya123 qwertyuiop admin abc123 The password manager has highlighted that ‚Äò1234‚Äôis one of the most used passwords with a count of about 76,981. It is also showcased that this password hardly takes less than 1 second to be cracked by any fraudsters. It is one of the easy passwords to crack. Next you have the ‚Äòpassword‚Äô, which just takes only 1 second to crack. Another one is ‚ÄòIndia123,‚Äô which just needs 2 minutes to crack.
Also Read Ransomware attacks surge in India: 24% increase in first half of 2024, Kaspersky reports The safety nets Passwords are an important gateway to our digital world. From protecting our devices to gatekeeping our digital data, passwords play an important role. So you need to make sure that your passwords are strong enough to strongly protect your device. But, how do you create strong passwords, which are not easy to crack. Here‚Äôs a few simple steps which you can use to create strong passwords:
First you need to avoid personal information and your password. For example, the date or day of your birth. You can use other odd digits. Try using a combination of numbers and signs. Even if they are small they are not easy to guess. You need to create a password of at least 8 digits. It‚Äôs safer to use a 12 digits password. Long passwords are hard to crack. Then you can use numbers, lowercase and uppercase in your passwords. This makes the password hard to guess. You can also use any phrases or abbreviations in your passwords Lastly, it‚Äôs also advisable to not to use your name as a password. Follow FE Tech Bytes on Twitter , Instagram , LinkedIn , Facebook

author: David Averre
title: Warm weather threatens Italy's ski season while heavy rain is leaving French Alps slopes a washout | Daily Mail Online
text: Holidaymakers aiming to hit the slopes in Italy and France are facing disappointment as the warmest December in Italy in 130 years and heavy rain in the French Alps threaten to wipe out the ski season. Italy's northern region of Piedmont, experiencing its warmest December since the 1890s, has seen winter resorts shutting down runs due to a lack of snow. Bardonecchia, a popular resort near the French border, has been particularly affected by a high-pressure weather system, with temperatures reaching as high as 16C in the depths of December. Resorts in the Apennine mountains outside Rome, including Terminillo and Ovindoli, have also faced challenges with inadequate snow cover, leading to the closure of slopes despite busy Christmas bookings. Meanwhile, in France, the popular resorts of Morzine and Les Gets were forced to delay the opening of the ski season due to monsoon-like downpours, with temperatures not cold enough to precipitate proper snowfall. Though some light powder has dusted pistes in recent days, more rain is expected to overrun the slopes. The disappointing conditions come after Spanish meteorologists warned that December temperatures across much of Western and Southern Europe would be far higher than normal. Ruben del Campo, a spokesperson for Spain 's national weather agency, said earlier this month that the unseasonable warmth, coupled with predictions of sparse rainfall until the end of February, heralded a 'not very good' season for winter sports that depend on abundant snow, which once melted is also a crucial water resource for the spring and summer months. Bardonecchia, a popular resort near the French border, has been particularly affected by a high-pressure weather system, with temperatures reaching as high as 16C in the depths of December Grass shows through the sparse snow on a piste in the French resort of Les Gets today Green hills that should be laden with snow in the Italian ski village of Terminillo There is barely enough snow to ski on at Le Plateau de Nyon in Morzine, France Temperatures across Spain in mid-December smashed records, pushing the mercury close to 30 degrees Celsius (86 Fahrenheit) in the south and delaying the start of the ski season. And several regions of Italy normally ripe for skiing at this time of year have been far warmer than usual as temperatures in the Alpine city of Turin crested 20C the week before Christmas. Enrico Rossi, director of the ski lift company Colomion and vice-president of the Bardonecchia tourism consortium, admitted that there was not enough snow to open all the slopes. 'During this period last year, we had four more [slopes] open. We have given priority to the beginner slopes, making artificial snow for them. We are postponing the opening of the difficult ones, which are also the least crowded,' he told The Telegraph . Luca Mercalli, president of the Italian Meteorological Society, attributed the rise in temperatures to global warming and warned of a grim outlook for Alpine regions, saying the temperatures he had seen in December were akin to those expected in late summer. 'The continuous increase in temperatures due to global warming will cause a further reduction in the winter season in the future, with more rain and less snow even at high altitudes. 'In the days before Christmas, to find zero degrees celsius you had to go up to almost 3,000m [9,900ft] and these are temperatures we normally find in late summer,' he added. Sunset in the Italian Alps bathes this view of the town of Bardonecchia, Piedmont Taken in a previous season, this piste in the French ski resort of Morzine shows how things should be It comes after higher temperatures and adverse weather conditions wrought havoc on the skiing World Cup in early December. Rainfall in the French Alps forced the cancellation of six races. Sharing a statement on December 10, t he International Ski and Snowboard Federation said the men's slalom - one of the centrepieces of the World Cup - could not start 'due to the present slope conditions after last night's rain and snow to ensure the safety and fairness for the racers'. The scheduled start time had already been pushed back in anticipation of course workers needing more time to clear the snow and ensure parts of the run which had been lashed by rain were safe to ski on. The race is expected to be rescheduled at a different venue later in the season.

author: Javier Escorzo
title: Juantxo Skalari: ‚ÄúProcuro reservar mis tiempos de reflexi√≥n, no tomarme la vida a toda prisa‚Äù
text: ‚Äì Con treinta a√±os de carrera, el m√∫sico navarro tocar√° sus nuevas canciones, pero tambi√©n recordar√° √©pocas anteriores, tanto en solitario como con Skalariak. 2023 fue un gran a√±o para Juantxo Skalari, con bastantes conciertos por Europa e Iberoam√©rica y un importante repunte de seguidores. ‚ÄìEn general, esto es como una evoluci√≥n. Por ejemplo, con el √∫ltimo disco, Radical Park, s√≠ que se ha notado bastante subida en las plataformas digitales tipo Spotify o dem√°s. A nivel f√≠sico no se puede comparar nada porque ya no se venden discos. He tocado mucho, he salido bastante‚Ä¶ Tengo buenas sensaciones, la verdad. ¬øY por qu√© cree que se ha dado este repunte ahora? Porque lleva treinta a√±os en la m√∫sica... ‚ÄìTampoco creas que ha sido un repunte incre√≠ble. Yo creo que es m√°s como una evoluci√≥n de bastantes a√±os. El mundo de la m√∫sica no es regular, va por momentos, sensaciones‚Ä¶ En mi caso, lo puedo notar m√°s a nivel geogr√°fico: en un momento dado est√°s m√°s fuerte en una parte, en Euskal Herria, en el estado espa√±ol, en Latinoam√©rica‚Ä¶ Quiz√°s ahora se empieza a notar m√°s en Europa, donde durante unos a√±os la cosa ha estado m√°s parada, no solo a nivel de Skalari, sino en general de la m√∫sica que yo hago: ska, reggae, rock alternativo, punk rock o como le quieras llamar. Ah√≠ s√≠ que noto m√°s movimiento, igual que en Latinoam√©rica y en el Estado. No sabr√≠a definir las causas. Supongo que la gente va viendo la evoluci√≥n y se va reencontrando. Ha hecho falta un tiempo para definir bien el proyecto: qu√© es Juantxo Skalari, qu√© es la Rude Band‚Ä¶ Antes me identificaban como el cantante de Skalariak, ahora ya ven que esto es un proyecto s√≥lido, que tiene su ligaz√≥n, pero que es un proyecto diferente, con su propio recorrido y ya consolidado. Como bien dice, el nuevo disco, ‚ÄòRadical Park‚Äô, tiene una entidad propia, pero mantiene un nexo conceptual con los anteriores, ¬øno? ‚ÄìTodos los discos, a nivel conceptual, est√°n enlazados, explican una historia. Puedes explicar la historia del propio disco, pero tambi√©n la del concepto que lo liga con los anteriores. El primer disco, Rude Station, fue como el desembarco en la estaci√≥n de la resistencia, el descubrimiento de lo que hab√≠a alrededor. Ves que hay una tienda, Rudi Records, que fue el segundo √°lbum. Al salir de la tienda, ves que esa tienda pertenece a un mercado que engloba m√°s cosas, y eso fue Roots Market, el tercer disco. Cuando sigues explorando, te das cuenta de que todo pertenece al Radical Park, que es donde estamos ahora. Por eso digo que todos los discos cuentan una historia. En este caso, si ves el dise√±o del vinilo de este Radical Park, se puede ver c√≥mo me imagino yo ese territorio imaginario que estamos descubriendo. El disco se titula ‚ÄòRadical Park episodio 1‚Äô, lo cual da a entender que estamos en un cap√≠tulo nuevo y que seguir√° desarroll√°ndose en futuros trabajos. ‚ÄìS√≠, estamos en el episodio 1, le he querido dar ese toque conceptual o cinematogr√°fico. Si estamos en el 1, se supone que luego vendr√° el episodio 2. La parte cinematogr√°fica es muy importante en este disco; en los interludios que aparecen entre canci√≥n y canci√≥n hay unos peque√±os di√°logos que te sit√∫an en el Radical Park; al principio, la Sarrera, que es la intro del disco, parece una sinton√≠a televisiva, como de primer episodio. El disco tiene su propio concepto, las palabras que lo definen son diversi√≥n y conciencia. Las siete canciones giran en torno a esos dos t√©rminos. Ha trabajado con el productor Mr. Hugsound. ¬øC√≥mo ha sido la grabaci√≥n? ‚ÄìLa preproducci√≥n del disco empez√≥ la primavera del a√±o pasado. Hice diferentes viajes a Basement Records, el estudio de Mr. Hugsound en Girona. Ten√≠a muy buenas sensaciones, aunque no sab√≠a todav√≠a cu√°ntas canciones iban a formar el disco. Ha sido muy interesante trabajar con √©l, es bastante joven que yo, tiene veintipico a√±os y tiene mucha espontaneidad. Hemos formado un buen equipo. Lo grabamos en La Casa Morada, una mas√≠a perdida en Tarragona. Estuvimos varias semanas, a finales de agosto y principios de septiembre. Van a lanzar tambi√©n una versi√≥n Dolby Atmos del disco. ¬øDe qu√© se trata eso exactamente? ‚ÄìDolby Atmos es una dimension de sonido 7.1, un sonido envolvente. Est√° pensando m√°s para cine, y como el disco tiene ese toque cinematogr√°fico, hemos querido lanzar tambi√©n esta versi√≥n. Antes los discos se sacaban en mono. Ahora, casi todos salen en stereo, que te permite escuchar cosas distintas por la izquierda y la derecha. Con el Dolby Atmos puedes escucharlo por siete altavoces, puedes escuchar cosas por delante, por arriba, por detr√°s‚Ä¶ El sonido te envuelve. De momento tenemos el single en este formato, No volver√°n. Los textos de las canciones abordan diferentes tem√°ticas. ¬øQu√© le resulta m√°s sencillo, escribir textos reivindicativos, o tocar temas m√°s personales, como hace en ‚ÄòMamma‚Äô, la canci√≥n que cierra el disco? ‚ÄìNo ten√≠a claro si meter esta canci√≥n o no, pero al final creo que ha quedado muy bien. A nivel r√≠tmico, el disco va de m√°s a menos y creo que queda como un bonito cierre. Es una canci√≥n muy personal, como dices, habla de mi madre. Todo el mundo tiene una madre, as√≠ que todo el mundo puede sentirse identificado. Tiene un ritmo reggae, que nunca lo hab√≠a explorado. Es m√°s hablada, m√°s po√©tica. Acaba con un piano, la voz‚Ä¶ No tengo ning√∫n problema en tocar temas personales o temas sociales o pol√≠ticos. Hago lo que me pide el cuerpo en cada momento. En la canci√≥n que abre el disco, ‚ÄòAquella generaci√≥n‚Äô, echa la vista atr√°s, hacia aquellos a√±os 90. Dice que es imposible seguir el ritmo y que hay que asumirlo. ¬øA qu√© se refiere? Porque, al menos musicalmente, usted no baja el pist√≥n, siempre con giras, viajes y proyectos. ‚ÄìA lo que se refiere esa frase es al momento en el que vivimos, este momento de neoliberalismo total, de inmediatez absoluta, de prisa‚Ä¶ Vivimos un momento vertiginoso. Comparo lo que vivi√≥ mi generaci√≥n con lo que viven las generaciones de ahora, como puede ser la de mi hija. Lo hago sin √°nimo de criticar, solo pretendo explicar las diferencias, que a veces son para bien y a veces para mal. Creo que tenemos el defecto de ir siempre con prisa, de querer todo para ya. Yo hago mis viajes y desde fuera puede parecer que estoy todo el rato a mucha velocidad, pero no, procuro reservar mis tiempos de reflexi√≥n y no tomarme la vida a toda prisa. ¬øC√≥mo ha sido el inicio de la gira? ¬øCon ganas de llegar a Pamplona? ‚ÄìLa gira empez√≥ en Europa con tres conciertos en Suiza, Italia y Francia. La presentaci√≥n oficial del disco fue en Barcelona con un concierto muy guapo. Estoy muy satisfecho de c√≥mo est√° funcionando; de hecho, estamos tocando las siete canciones del √°lbum, creo que lo merecen y veo que funcionan muy bien. Tengo muchas ganas de tocar en Pamplona. Iru√±a siempre es especial, est√° la familia, los amigos‚Ä¶ Reencontrarme con mi ciudad natal siempre es bonito. Har√© un recorrido por otros discos y por distintas √©pocas de Skalariak. Como cosa especial, estar√° Olatz Andueza, una acordeonista, una vieja colaboradora de la √©poca de Skalariak. Haremos un repertorio extenso, lo espero con much√≠simas ganas. l

author: Regina Sienra
title: Man Experiencing Homelessness Tells How His Dog Saved his Life
text: [Sometimes we forget what's truly important in life] by [u/Noughty_Kudit]in [DOG] In many ways, dogs can save lives. They work in rescue teams and can detect when their owners are in distress; but sometimes, the saving is done at a more spiritual and personal level. Bailey, a pup who lives in the UK, has been credited for this by his human, Andy. As a man experiencing homelessness, Andy told [Channel 4](https://www.channel4.com/) that Bailey has given him purpose, and has even brought him back from his darkest moments. In an [interview](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RUaEDuxAVhY) first recorded in 2017, Andy shared his story alongside Bailey. Addressing the hardships of homelessness and overcoming addiction, he describes their relationship as ‚Äúmore than anything, it's company. It's having another heartbeat that's on your side.‚Äù He got Bailey when the pup was just four weeks old, revealing that he hasn't taken drugs ever since the dog came into his life. ‚ÄúWhen you're stood there, hungry, and no one's noticing you, your mind convinces you that you're worthless, that you don't count,‚Äù Andy shared. ‚ÄúBut with him, he looks to me for his food, he looks to me for love, he looks to me to play with him. It gives me a role. It might even be a tiny role, but it's a purpose.‚Äù Since he is in temporary accommodation, Bailey has given him an additional reason to stay on track. ‚ÄúIf I get arrested and go to prison, I lose my dog. They'll rehome him and that will be that. If I lose my place, I lose my dog, you know?‚Äù And while he also sees it from the personal perspective of his own wellbeing, Bailey is also ‚Äúan extra incentive to do good.‚Äù He added that even walking Bailey can change his mindset when his mind slips to his addictions. The lovable pooch also allows him to meet people he wouldn't interact with otherwise. ‚ÄúAt the end of the day, when you shut the door and turn the light out, he's the one I reach for.‚Äù Ultimately, Bailey seems to have taught him about love. ‚ÄúHonestly, [dogs] can cure anything. It's all about love,‚Äù he concludes. ‚ÄúAnd through him I've learned how to give love, more importantly receive it, and he loves me unconditionally, you know? It's wonderful.‚Äù Andy, a man experiencing homelessness, recounts how his dog Bailey has given him purpose, and has even brought him back from his darkest moments. Related Articles: [Man Experiencing Homelessness Throws a Birthday Party for His Dogs, Then His Life Changes](https://mymodernmet.com/choko-dog-birthday-party-homelessness/) [Loyal Stray Dogs Show Up at Hospital Where Homeless Caretaker is Being Treated](https://mymodernmet.com/dogs-wait-for-owner-at-hospital/) [Man Experiencing Homelessness Climbs Into Dog Shelter on Fire to Rescue 25 Pups](https://mymodernmet.com/sebastian-arias-dog-shelter-fire-peru/) [108-Year-Old Woman Credits Having ‚ÄúDogs, Not Kids‚Äù as Her Secret to a Long Life](https://mymodernmet.com/ada-daniel-108-year-old-dogs-not-kids/)

author: Business Matters
title: Rachel Reeves unveils new economic advisory council to drive UK growth
text:
Rachel Reeves is set to announce the establishment of an Economic Advisory Council to spearhead Labour‚Äôs primary ‚Äúnational mission‚Äù of economic expansion following the party‚Äôs recent landslide victory in the general election. The council will be chaired by John Van Reenen, a distinguished innovation expert and former Downing Street policy adviser during Tony Blair ‚Äôs tenure. Van Reenen, currently a professor at the London School of Economics (LSE), will lead this pivotal body positioned within the Treasury.
The council will initially comprise four members, including Anna Valero, a senior policy fellow at the LSE. Valero, known for her expertise in productivity, previously served on Jeremy Hunt‚Äôs economic advisory council, which was dissolved last year. She was also among the economists endorsing Labour‚Äôs economic strategies in a pre-election letter to The Guardian.
Reeves aims to harness a diverse array of insights from independent experts through the council. She has pledged to initiate a ‚Äúdecade of national renewal‚Äù by strengthening the economy‚Äôs foundations.
Key appointments to the council include Spencer Thompson, a former economist at the Institute for Public Policy Research, and Neil Amin-Smith, a Cambridge-educated economist and former violinist of the Grammy-winning band Clean Bandit. Thompson has been advising Labour on economic policy since 2020, while Amin-Smith transitioned to Labour from the Treasury two years ago.
In addition to forming the council, Labour is restructuring Whitehall‚Äôs operations to fulfil its governmental agenda. This restructuring includes the creation of ‚Äúmission delivery boards‚Äù featuring senior figures from business, economics, and other specialised fields.

author: Kaseya
title: Kaseya‚Äôs 2023 Highlights and the Road Ahead
text: Kaseya‚Äôs 2023 Highlights and the Road Ahead Woohoo! What an exciting year 2023 turned out to be. Right from upgrading to VSA 10 to unlocking the efficiencies between the Kaseya and Datto solutions and making the strategic acquisition of Vonahi Security, Kaseya has delivered tons of amazing benefits to its customers in 2023. As we stand on the cusp of 2024, we‚Äôd like to take a moment to celebrate the milestones and victories that marked our journey. Join us as we take stock of all that we have achieved and give you a glimpse into what lies ahead. VSA 10 upgrade The VSA 10 upgrade was one of the biggest wins of the year. Even though VSA 9 was powerful without comparison, harnessing its complete potential was no mean feat. The following are the key upgrades that distinguish and differentiate [VSA 10](https://www.kaseya.com/get-started/vsa-demo/) from its predecessor: Cutting-edge automation Powered by cutting-edge automation, VSA 10 saves users hundreds and thousands of hours of manual work while also making managing complex tasks seem like a breeze. This gives users the freedom to focus on more creative tasks while the mundane work is handled automatically. We received reports of higher productivity, more efficiency and better work-life balance by our hard-working technicians. Scripting flexibility Another notable change that makes VSA 10 more intuitive is the swapping of the proprietary scripting language of VSA 9‚Äôs Agent Procedures for industry-standard PowerShell, Bash, Batch and VBScript. This upgrade gave users more flexibility and freedom to tailor their scripting processes according to their specific needs and preferences. Access to widely used scripting languages makes it easier to integrate VSA 10 with a wide range of tools and existing networks. Seamless integrations The [Kaseya IT Complete platform](https://www.kaseya.com/) that provides seamless integration with a host of critical IT tools makes VSA even more powerful. This year, we further strengthened the connection between Kaseya and Datto solutions with several crucial integrations. Some of the standout integrations that users love are those with [Datto Networking solutions](https://www.datto.com/products/networking/) and with PSA solutions like [Autotask](https://www.datto.com/products/autotask-psa/), [BMS](https://www.kaseya.com/products/bms/) and Vorex. The integration between VSA and Datto‚Äôs networking solutions, which are considered the best in the industry, promises to make discovering, deploying and managing networks effortless and cost-effective for technicians. While SMBs can impress their end users with consistent uptime and exceptional performance, MSPs can deliver high-quality managed networking services in a way that will give them a competitive edge and boost profitability. An advanced policy module for greater efficiency Worth mentioning here is the new advanced policy module in VSA 10 that allows policies to be broken up into containerized objects, making it incredibly easy for managed service providers (MSPs) or IT departments to modify policies to meet the specific needs of their clients and end users. For instance, an MSP can create a policy object that includes all security settings for a client and then create a second policy object for the client‚Äôs workstations that includes all network access permissions. Mobile device management We also took note of the demand for [mobile device management (MDM)](https://www.kaseya.com/blog/mobile-device-management-mdm/) capabilities and added that to VSA 10. Whether it‚Äôs the organization‚Äôs own or employee-owned iPhones, iPads or Android devices, technicians can monitor, manage and secure them easily via the Kaseya console. The addition of MDM fulfills our vision of making VSA 10 a truly unified and remote monitoring and management (RMM) solution. It eliminates the need for users to use different management solutions for each type of device, making the management process seamless. Top-notch security Not just an efficient RMM solution, VSA 10 also doubles up as a formidable security solution. Designed to detect and stop threats like ransomware, and eliminate vulnerabilities through advanced patching capabilities, it provides a secure environment for businesses to operate. VSA 10 also provides real-time monitoring of all systems, ensuring that any potential issues are identified and addressed quickly. Kaseya Help Desk Service The [Kaseya Help Desk Service](https://www.kaseya.com/products/help-desk-services/) is our hottest new service launch of the year. It instantly enables MSPs and IT departments to expand their coverage and deliver best-in-class service delivery without expanding their payroll. Bolstered by 100% in-region staff (Orlando, Florida and Dundalk) and operating round the clock, our help desk service will manage the daily delivery and management of L1 and L2 tickets for customers, ensuring data sovereignty that supports major international compliance standards. This is truly one of the biggest launches in Kaseya‚Äôs history, freeing MSPs and IT departments from the clutches of the ‚Äúhave-you-tried-turning-it-off-and-on-again‚Äù script, freeing them to drive innovation and optimize services. Vonahi and audIT acquisitions At Kaseya, we relentlessly seek to make IT management easier for our customers. We aim to be the one-stop shop for any solution they need to manage their IT. To this end, we acquired Vonahi Security earlier this year. Vonahi, a pioneer in automated [network penetration testing](https://www.kaseya.com/blog/network-penetration-testing/), brings value to Kaseya‚Äôs security suite by expanding its scope and reach to meet a wider set of customer needs. vPenTest, an automated network penetration test platform developed by Vonahi, combines a hacker‚Äôs knowledge, methodology, processes and toolsets into a single, deployable SaaS platform. It‚Äôs designed in such a way that organizations of all sizes can use it to strengthen their IT environment easily, by performing a penetration test within their environment at any time. The best part ‚Äî vPenTest provides more value at similar to less costs compared to traditional penetration tests. The company also completed its acquisition and integration of [audIT](https://www.channelfutures.com/mergers-acquisitions/kaseya-wraps-acquisition-of-simplified-sales-tool-audit), a premier and automated SaaS-based sales presentation system, in 2023. The solution allows MSPs to create impressive sales presentations in under 30 minutes that allows them to showcase the value of their work creatively and win the business of more prospects. With audIT, technicians can save a good four to six hours that typically go towards creating a presentation while leaving a better impression on clients. It‚Äôs the secret weapon in our MSPs‚Äô arsenal to gain a competitive edge. The IT Complete stack The IT Complete stack has become even more comprehensive and powerful thanks to additional integrations with Datto solutions and acquisitions of Vonahi and audIT. With a continued focus on providing seamless workflows between tools and helping IT professionals and teams do their jobs efficiently, IT Complete continues to be a work in progress, with several more integrations in the pipeline. Closing thoughts While 2023 was a standout year for Kaseya and its customers, get ready to buckle up for an even more electrifying ride in 2024. We will be sharing news that‚Äôs set to make waves in the IT industry like never before. No, it‚Äôs not another acquisition, partnership or IPO announcement. You‚Äôll have to tune in to [Connect Global 2024](https://www.kaseyaconnect.com/) for the big reveal. It‚Äôs an exciting time for Kaseya and its customers. There‚Äôs plenty to look back on with pride and even more to look forward to. The post [Kaseya‚Äôs 2023 Highlights and the Road Ahead](https://www.kaseya.com/blog/kaseya-2023-highlights-and-2024-outlook/) appeared first on [Kaseya](https://www.kaseya.com/). [Blog - Kaseya](https://www.kaseya.com/blog/) authored by [Kaseya](https: //www.kaseya.com/blog/kaseya-2023-highlights-and-2024-outlook/](https://www.kaseya.com/blog/kaseya-2023-highlights-and-2024-outlook/)

author: AndreaGarcia
title: Lluvia pone en aprietos al M√©rida Open 2024
text: A pesar de toda la expectativa que estaba puesta en la segunda edici√≥n del M√©rida Open AKRON 2024, el torneo no ha podido llevarse con √©xito, pues la lluvia ha impedido que los juegos se disputen de manera corrida y han sido suspendidos constantemente.Desde el lunes que comenz√≥ la competencia se han presentado este tipo de retos. La precipitaci√≥n por momentos ha dado tregua, pero no la suficiente para que los duelos se lleven a cabo con normalidad; de hecho, el martes se tuvieron que reprogramar un par de compromisos, lo que dej√≥ al mi√©rcoles lleno de actividad.Uno de los partidos que se tuvieron que jugar en fuera del tiempo acordado, fue precisamente el de Renata Zaraz√∫a, la mexicana tuvo que ponerle pausa para conocer su futuro y vencer a la estadounidense Akasha Urhobo.Este jueves, las acciones comenzaron desde las 14:00 horas, sin embargo, una tormenta impidi√≥ que el primer juego de la jornada entre Nina Stojanovic y Marina Stakusic se realizara en tiempo, siendo suspendido por m√°s de dos horas. Luego de reanudarse, Stojanovic derrot√≥ a Marina por parciales dobles de 6-3.Al momento, a√∫n faltan cuatro partidos por disputarse, siendo uno de los estelares el de Zaraz√∫a contra la polaca Maja Chwalinska, quienes se estar√°n enfrentando por el pase a Cuartos de Final, pero ante la lluvia moderada, a√∫n se desconoce si este encuentro podr√° realizarse.La tenista azteca ha sido una de las m√°s aclamadas por el p√∫blico, siendo l√≥gico al estar en su casa buscando el primer t√≠tulo de la WTA y tambi√©n en M√©xico. Aunque, por las condiciones climatol√≥gicas, no se sabe cu√°nto tiempo se podr√° esperar a conocer el desenlace.SV

author: Keystone-ats
title: Bianco natale? Per i servizi meteo √® poco probabile
text:
Un Natale bianco sembra poco probabile quest'anno in pianura, in base ai valori misurati finora, secondo diversi servizi meteorologici. Dal 1931, il 60% dei Natali √® stato verde sull'Altopiano svizzero. Una corrente occidentale sta portando aria mite atlantica sul continente, stando al sito web di MeteoSvizzera. In gran parte dell'Europa ci sono "segnali di temperature troppo miti per i giorni che precedono il Natale", secondo le previsioni dell'Ufficio federale di meteorologia e climatologia. Dello stesso parere il servizio meteorologico privato Meteonews. √à certo che dopo una fase pi√π mite e soleggiata, soprattutto in montagna, le temperature torneranno a raffreddarsi a partire da venerd√¨ prossimo, in particolare alle quote pi√π alte, si legge in una nota odierna. Tuttavia, non √® "assolutamente chiaro" come si svilupper√† il tempo prima e durante il Natale.
La speranza √® l'ultima a morire
Alcuni modelli meteorologici prevedono che, poco prima del 24-25 dicembre, un sistema di bassa pressione passer√† sopra la Svizzera, seguito da una situazione pi√π fresca a Natale, che potrebbe far scendere il limite delle nevicate a basse quote. Tuttavia, √® pi√π probabile che non faccia abbastanza freddo per avere la neve in pianura. Secondo Meteonews, c'√® comunque ancora timida speranza di un bianco Natale a basse quote. La tendenza meteorologica di quest'anno √® in linea con i dati climatici storici. Dal 1931, il 60% dei Natali nell'Altopiano centrale e orientale √® stato senza neve. Nella Svizzera occidentale e nord-occidentale, cos√¨ come nelle regioni di pianura a sud delle Alpi, questo dato sale rispettivamente al 75% e all'80%.
